result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erick G Hoefakker in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Erick G Hoefakker.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties request PTC.  Defn signed up for text message reminders.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

1:23 PM Defendant Erick G Hoefakker in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Erick G Hoefakker.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Adjustment Number: 22A 033878,
Payable Number: 567802,
Receipt Number: 22RS028265,
Amount: $20.00
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KNH except only through a third party and only to discuss financial matters, discuss matters relating to divorce proceedings, or to transfer the firearm safe key. 
- Defendant shall not make any copies of the firearm safe key. 
- Defendant shall transfer the firearm safe key to KNH within 10 days of release from custody. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CJV or KJW. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 5400 block of Day Tripper Ave in Madison. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

ADDRESS INFO for Erick G Hoefakker

Prior: 5426 Day Tripper Dr, Madison, WI 53718

01:38 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nate Kristian McClure.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
